trans-unit.source: Represents a setter that applies a property value.
<xref:System.Windows.Style>s and the different types of triggers (classes that inherit from <xref:System.Windows.TriggerBase>) use <xref:System.Windows.Setter>s to apply property values.
Note that you must specify both the <xref:System.Windows.Setter.Property%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Setter.Value%2A> properties on a <xref:System.Windows.Setter> for the setter to be meaningful.
If one or both properties are not set, an exception will be thrown.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Setter"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Setter"></xref> class with the specified property and value.
The <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref> to apply the <xref href="System.Windows.Setter.Value"></xref> to.
The value to apply to the property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Setter"></xref> class with the specified property, value, and target name.
The <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref> to apply the <xref href="System.Windows.Setter.Value"></xref> to.
The value to apply to the property.
The name of the child node this <xref href="System.Windows.Setter"></xref> is intended for.
Gets or sets the property to which the <xref href="System.Windows.Setter.Value"></xref> will be applied.
Note that you must specify both the <xref:System.Windows.Setter.Property%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Setter.Value%2A> properties on a <xref:System.Windows.Setter> or an exception will be thrown.
A <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref> to which the <xref href="System.Windows.Setter.Value"></xref> will be applied.
The default value is null.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Setter.Property"></xref> property cannot be `null`.
The specified <xref href="System.Windows.Setter.Property"></xref> property cannot be read-only.
If the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Setter.Value"></xref> is not valid for the type of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Setter.Property"></xref>.
Handles cases where a markup extension provides a value for a property of <xref href="System.Windows.Setter"></xref> object.

This is the method referenced by an applied <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlSetMarkupExtensionAttribute> attribute at the class level, which means that this method processes all attempts to set values of <xref:System.Windows.Setter> with a markup extension.
You do not typically call this method directly.
The object where the markup extension sets the value.
Data that is relevant for markup extension processing.
Handles cases where a type converter provides a value for a property of a <xref href="System.Windows.Setter"></xref> object.

This is the method referenced by an applied <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlSetTypeConverterAttribute> attribute at the class level, which means that this method processes all attempts to set values of <xref:System.Windows.Setter> with a type converter.
You do not typically call this method directly.
The object where the type converter sets the value.
Data that is relevant for type converter processing.
Gets or sets the name of the object this <xref href="System.Windows.Setter"></xref> is intended for.
You can set this property to the name of any element within the scope of where the setter collection (the collection that this setter is part of) is applied.
This is typically a named element that is within the template that contains this setter.
The default value is `null`.
Gets or sets the value to apply to the property that is specified by this <xref href="System.Windows.Setter"></xref>.
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Property Element Usage
XAML Values
*value*
An object or a markup extension.
See [StaticResource Markup Extension](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/staticresource-markup-extension.md).
Note that you must specify both the <xref:System.Windows.Setter.Property%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Setter.Value%2A> properties on a <xref:System.Windows.Setter> or an exception will be thrown.
Data binding and dynamic resources within the object is supported if the specified value is a <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object.
See [Binding Markup Extension](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/binding-markup-extension.md) and [DynamicResource Markup Extension](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dynamicresource-markup-extension.md).
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty.UnsetValue"></xref>.
If the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Setter.Value"></xref> is set to <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty.UnsetValue"></xref>.
Signals the object that initialization is starting.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Setter> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize> interface.
Signals the object that initialization is complete.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Setter> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize> interface.
